citations.narrative:
The barn in the donkey/goat enclosure has a large hole in the side wall. There is a gap between the outer wall and the
inner wall that is wide enough bayby goat to enter and possibly become stuck within the walls. The opening shall be
secured to prevent access and protect the goats from becoming trapped or injured. Correct by June 8, 2023
The barn in the extra goat enclosure on the hill is in disrepair. There are large pieces of would partially buried in the
ground in the inside of the barn. A large section of dirt below the boards on one end has eroded leaving the ends of the
boards, up to 2 approximately 2 feet in length, suspended above the hole. The suspended boards with gaps between
them large enough for limbs to pass through may allow the goats to become injured when attempting to cross them. The
boards shall be removed or secured and the hole filled to protect the goats from injury. Correct by June 8, 2023
The chain-link fencing placed around the two large trees near the fence of the goat enclosure has links that have become
unraveled causing exposed pointed wired that may cause puncture wounds should the goats come in contact with them..
The chain link shall be removed, repaired or replaced to protect the goats from possible injury. Correct by June 8, 2023
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class "C" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by July 16, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
